settings.map_address: 301 Front St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2T6

settings.text: Our story begins with JUANA LAUREL. Born in Cusco, Peru in 1965. Juana immigrated to the United States at 35 years old with only 30 dollars in her pocket. In 2010, she opened her retail shop in the heart of San Francisco, Mission xNeighborhood and named it Qosqo Maky and her husband dedicated half of their shop and crafting new products. Wanting to share her Peruvian heritage, she begun working with local producers from Cusco to bring their items to the United States

settings.title: Established in 2010
settings.text: Qosqo Maky is an Indigenous-owned small business, passionately dedicated to sharing the rich tapestry of Peruvian traditions and culture with a global audience. Our mission revolves around illuminating the diverse beauty of Peru for the world to appreciate.
